verses.text: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, Consider diligently what \add is\add* before thee:
And put a knife to thy throat, If thou \add be\add* a man given to appetite.
Be not desirous of his dainties: For they \add are\add* deceitful meat.
Labour not to be rich: Cease from thine own wisdom.
Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? For \add riches\add* certainly make themselves wings; They fly away as an eagle \add toward\add* heaven.
Eat thou not the bread of \add him that hath\add* an evil eye, Neither desire thou his dainty meats:
For as he thinketh in his heart, so \add is\add* he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; But his heart \add is\add* not with thee.
The morsel \add which\add* thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, And lose thy sweet words.
Speak not in the ears of a fool: For he will despise the wisdom of thy words.
Remove not the old landmark; And enter not into the fields of the fatherless:
For their Redeemer \add is\add* mighty; He shall plead their cause with thee.
Apply thine heart unto instruction, And thine ears to the words of knowledge.
Withhold not correction from the child: For \add if\add* thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.
Thou shalt beat him with the rod, And shalt deliver his soul from hell.
My son, if thine heart be wise, My heart shall rejoice, even mine.
Yea, my reins shall rejoice, When thy lips speak right things.
Let not thine heart envy sinners: But \add be thou\add* in the fear of the \sc Lord\sc* all the day long.
For surely there is an end; And thine expectation shall not be cut off.
Hear thou, my son, and be wise, And guide thine heart in the way.
Be not amongst winebibbers; Amongst riotous eaters of flesh:
For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: And drowsiness shall clothe \add a man\add* with rags.
Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, And despise not thy mother when she is old.
Buy the truth, and sell \add it\add* not; \add Also\add* wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.
The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: And he that begetteth a wise \add child\add* shall have joy of him.
Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, And she that bare thee shall rejoice.
My son, give me thine heart, And let thine eyes observe my ways.
For a whore \add is\add* a deep ditch; And a strange \add woman is\add* a narrow pit.
She also lieth in wait as \add for\add* a prey, And increaseth the transgressors among men.
Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? Who hath contentions? who hath babbling? Who hath wounds without cause? Who hath redness of eyes?
They that tarry long at the wine; They that go to seek mixt wine.
Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, When it giveth his colour in the cup, \add When\add* it moveth itself aright.
At the last it biteth like a serpent, And stingeth like an adder.
Thine eyes shall behold strange \add women\add*, And thine heart shall utter perverse things.
Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, Or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.
They have stricken me, \add shalt thou say, and\add* I was not sick; They have beaten me, \add and\add* I felt \add it\add* not: When shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.
